q: His Exhibit A was Darwin Eric Schmidt Smith, a low-key lawyer who transformed Kimberly-Clark into an industry leader in the 1970s and'80s. A rung lower in Collins' leadership hierarchy were the Level 4 types: those who catalyze commitment to and vigorous pursuit of a clear and compelling vision-- the profile of most enduring technology industry founder-CEOs. While company needs will vary, there's a strong case for why the visionary variety of CEO still matters in technology more than any other industry. Innovation
